xanga. blogger. xanga. blogger. what the heck am i to do? i keep going between them! fixed my camera, and i'm picking up the jeep today. i'm so giddy i could wet myself. really.
i hate them. however, they do make urlLink satire rather simple!
if big sky, montana blows up anytime in the near future, burn all my stuff in a massive sacrificial pyre (i love that word! pyre pyre pyre!) i'll be missing y'all mucho. adios.

look at the resemblance between bill clinton's mom and monica lewinsky in these photographs from a time magazine i stole from the expresslube while the changed the tranny fluid in my yak. isnt the resemblance uncanny? i suppose he had relations with her on account of she looked like his mom and he has an oedipus complex. *note: i can't be sued for libel on account of i was just supposing.
clinton's parents. urlLink urlLink

this blog's research team turned up something interesting today while having a look-see in various obscure news sources (des moines is considered obscure by my standards). i love poor word choices! MANLY urlLink STRIPPERS NOT WANTED

yesterday was good fun, so i wont mind the general tedious threat posed by today. I have to learn lady madonna by the beatles on my guitar before 3 pm for my lesson, and i have to (dun dun dun) CLEAN MY ROOM!
what a day. ian, michele, jessica, tanner, lizzie, dustin, zack, and sos arrived in that order. we farted around. the pictures tell the story.
dustin lightly spritzes zack with the tomato juice gun of justice urlLink urlLink
vegan revenge: a water gun full of tomato juice and civil disobedience, together at last urlLink urlLink
the end of the great water war between sos and dustin urlLink urlLink
sos took that last water shot like a man. a man who was concerned about his dry-clean-only jeans. urlLink urlLink
heidi is an odd dog urlLink urlLink
here's me testing my shutter in the car after dropping my camera! urlLink urlLink
here's the view from a road i took the c110 up to at the cabin. its smoky on account of the fires. FUEGO! urlLink urlLink

you know something? i though blogger was pure. xanga is so very sick, contaminated with the babble of people who write alot, but dont say anything, people who add slow-loading 190,000* kbps music files from their flourescent, stereotypical, impossible-to-read formatted blogs, and people who abuse letter/number substitutions and have a spastic caps lock key. unfortunately, there is no cure for dumbass. blogger has been contaminated. i have only seen one page so far, a 0 for an o, a typical "[cap][lowercase[cap][lower]..." pattern, and the site was about what? nothing. i am not mean, i will not link. but this makes me sad, i like blogger. now it has internet leoprosy. how sad!

i am back from pismo, and i have hardly any urlLink pictures . i think that's because i only photograph certain situations that i find funny, and that is hard to predict. there are some candid ones i am somewhat proud of though. the trip was killer! "I'm Gumby, dammit!"
well, that was a hell of a thing. i'll have some pictures up soon. i had to use xanga for a while on account of i couldn't upload photos on a hellish slow connection. this is photo hosting only now.
here's a picture i found from my travels in Montana. that was a...uh...different kind of day. urlLink urlLink

okay, the movie as a whole, well, was somewhat lacking. it definetely had its moments, but the character that made it all worthwhile was Brick, the weatherman. "hi, i'm brick. someday, a doctor will tell me i have an I.Q. of 48, and will be considered by some to be mentally retarded." (mind you, he is filling a plugged-in toaster with mayonaise [sp?] as he says this.)
